sentences.text: Fiscal Year 2016 Compensation Practices and Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive pay is reasonable and provides appropriate incentives to our executives to achieve our financial and strategic goals without encouraging them to take excessive risks in their business decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We regularly evaluate the major risks to our business, including how risks taken by management could impact the value of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To this end, we note the following regarding our compensation practices:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights of Our Executive Compensation ProgramLinking Pay with Performance and Mitigating Risk   Best Practices   Use performance metrics to align pay with performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cap payouts under our annual cash bonus plan and performance share plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require our CEO to own stock equal in value to 6 times base salary, and the CFO and senior executives to own stock equal in value to 3 times base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require other executives to own our stock and require the amount of their stock ownership to increase with their level of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require executives to retain all options and equity grants until required ownership levels are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apply clawback obligations to annual cash bonus and equity awards for executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regularly review the Compensation Committee charter to ensure best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Engage an independent compensation consultant that reports to the Compensation Committee and that provides no other services to AmerisourceBergen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consider a peer group in establishing CEO and CFO compensation, and consider published compensation survey data for our other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibit short sales, hedging or pledging of our stock by our executive officers and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require forfeiture of awards upon violation of restrictive covenants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require double-trigger for change in control payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consider burn rate in equity grant decisions and manage use of equity plan conservatively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Practices We   Compensation practices that encourage excessively risky business decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Do Not Allow   Paying for poor performance under our incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Granting stock options with an exercise price lower than fair market value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Backdating or retroactively granting options or restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Paying dividends on unearned and unvested performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Repricing stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing tax gross-ups in the event of a change in control.

sentences.text: 2016 Fiscal Year Business Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's performance in fiscal 2016 included the acquisition of PharMEDium, the renewal of relationships with key customers in our core business, and continued execution of our strategic plan, which includes the growth of all of our business units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those achievements and others were accomplished in the face of a rapidly changing and challenging environment in which anticipated benefits from brand and generic drug price inflation declined throughout the fiscal year.

sentences.text: We believe that the fiscal year 2016 compensation of our named executive officers was aligned with AmerisourceBergen's adjusted fiscal year 2016 results and met our compensation objectives.

sentences.text: Setting Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider market pay practices as a starting reference point when setting executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee assesses whether our level of executive pay is appropriate when compared to industry and market standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee's independent compensation consultant assists the Compensation Committee in developing a peer group of companies to serve as the basis for comparing the pay of our named executive officers to the market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We conduct a detailed market review of executive pay to evaluate each element of pay and benefit competitiveness, review pay practices and compare performance against our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our peer group is composed of companies with business models and operations comparable to our own, including our two largest direct competitors, and companies that we believe have a similar financial and operational profile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Metrics used to select our peer group include: revenue; market capitalization; net income; operating income margin; and return on invested capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our peer group reflects the type and complexity of business risks managed by our executives and that we compete with many of the companies in our peer group for executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, the Compensation Committee, in consultation with its independent compensation consultant, evaluated our peer group to ensure that ou peer group companies were still appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following its review, the Compensation Committee concluded that our current peers remained reasonable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 peer group as determined by the Compensation Committee was as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We target base salary in the 35th percentile for similar positions in our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By positioning base salary below our peer median, we place greater emphasis on incentive compensation for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2015, Mr. Collis's, Mr. Guttman's, and Mr. Chou's base salaries were increased by 4.2%, 4.4% and 4.0%, respectively, to reflect individual performance and align them with the market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Frary's base salary was increased by 3.4% to reflect the strong growth of ABSG.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mauch's base salary was ncreased by 11.1%, primarily to reflect the increased scope of his responsibilities during his first full fiscal year as Executive Vice President and President of ABDC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, the Compensation Committee accepted management's recommendation that the named executive officers and our other senior executives receive no increase in base salary for fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FY2016 Cash Bonus Payout
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves the performance goals and incentive levels for each of our named executive officers, and assigns a relative weighting to each performance measure under our cash incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each performance measure, there is a threshold and a target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Threshold refers to the minimum acceptable level of performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not pay a bonus on a particular financial measure if our performance is at or below the threshold, except with respect to the operating income margin financial measure, where we pay 50% at threshold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target is the expected level of performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All cash incentive awards are issued to the executives pursuant to our Omnibus Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives may receive an amount in excess of their target bonus (up to a maximum of 200% of the target incentive) if we exceed target on the key performance metric established for them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, an individual's actual bonus consists of the amount determined for exceeding the thresholds and, if applicable, an amount (which we refer to as a "stretch" bonus) for exceeding target on the key performance metric established for them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key performance metric for Mr. Collis, Mr. Guttman and Mr. Chou was adjusted EPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key performance metric for Mr. Frary was ABSG consolidated operating income, and the key performance metric for Mr. Mauch was ABDC operating income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stretch portion is calculated by increasing the earned bonus by an additional 5% for every 1% that actual performance exceeds target on the key performance metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, if actual adjusted EPS exceeded target adjusted EPS by 1%, for the three named executive officers with adjusted EPS as the key metric, the stretch portion would be calculated by multiplying earned bonus by 5%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee chose adjusted EPS, adjusted operating income, adjusted operating income margin and free cash flow as corporate-level goals because they are the key metrics used by management to set business goals and evaluate our financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we communicate our expectations about future business performance to investors by using an adjusted EPS range each fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally set adjusted EPS targets to reflect our long-term business goal of growing adjusted EPS in the mid-teens, while allowing for reasonable flexibility to set our annual targets based on the impact of industry trends, other market factors and special items from year to year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee chose adjusted operating income and adjusted operating income margin to encourage our executives to grow our Company's profitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use free cash flow as a corporate-level financial metric because the amount of free cash flow that we generate each year is essential for us to maintain appropriate working capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Free cash flow is also an important consideration for our investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO, CFO and General Counsel's fiscal year 2016 cash bonuses were designed to reflect enterprise-wide performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, 100% of their bonus payments were dependent upon the achievement of corporate financial performance goals with adjusted EPS and adjusted operating income each weighted at 30% of the total target incentive and adjusted operating income margin and free cash flow each weighted at 20% of the total target incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Frary is the executive in charge of ABSG and Mr. Mauch is the executive in charge of ABDC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our World Courier and AmerisourceBergen Consulting Services businesses report to Mr. Frary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the results of World Courier and AmerisourceBergen Consulting Services were included in ABSG's consolidated results for purposes of calculating Mr. Frary's fiscal year 2016 bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Mr. Frary and Mr. Mauch, as named executive officers leading specific business units, a substantial part of their bonuses are tied to business unit performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee selects business unit performance goals that are designed to help us achieve our overall Company corporate performance goals for the fiscal year (i.e., adjusted EPS, adjusted operating income, adjusted operating income margin and free cash flow).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business unit operating goals also take into account the risk profile and market dynamics in each business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Frary's and Mr. Mauch's fiscal year 2016 cash bonuses were based 30% on the Company's adjusted EPS, 20% on the Company's adjusted operating ncome, and 50% on business-specific operating metrics, with weightings of 40% on business unit operating income and 10% on business unit pre-tax profit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes this mix appropriately links pay to Mr. Frary's and Mr. Mauch's respective operating responsibilities while also aligning their goals with the broader organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee chose business unit operating income because it is the primary indicator of profitability for each business and emphasizes our drive toward efficiency in our operations, and it chose pre-tax profit to focus ABSG and ABDC on capital efficient growth in their respective markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Frary's 2016 stretch bonus opportunity was based on the consolidated operating income of ABSG, and Mr. Mauch's 2016 stretch bonus was based on the operating income of ABDC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Frary's and Mr. Mauch's goals were intended to be challenging and to provide an incentive for them to drive their business units to help achieve our strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For ABSG, those objectives included increasing our international exposure and penetration in select global markets through complementary acquisitions and other commercial arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For ABDC, those objectives included expanding into new lines of business that leverage off of our existing strengths.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, ABSG's consolidated results exceeded target on both business unit performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, ABDC's results did not exceed target on ABDC operating income and ABDC pre-tax profit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ABDC has not achieved target on two of the business unit cash incentive financial performance measures applicable to a named executive officer in three of the last five fiscal years (FY12 - FY16).

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, the Compensation Committee approved performance measures for our fiscal year 2017 annual cash incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017 the fiscal year cash bonus will continue be paid solely on the attainment of financial performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For named executive officers whose compensation is based entirely on Company performance, the metrics are the Company's adjusted EPS, adjusted operating income, adjusted operating income margin and free cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For named executive officers whose compensation is based on both Company and business unit performance, the metrics are the Company's adjusted EPS, adjusted operating income margin and free cash flow, and the applicable business unit's operating income and pre-tax profit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These metrics are intended to be challenging and to provide an incentive to achieve the goals set out in our fiscal year 2017 business plan and the strategic and other priorities established by our long-range plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal year 2017 target incentive levels for the named executive officers range from 100% to 150% of base salary, with the opportunity for each named executive officer to earn up to a maximum of 200% of target incentive if we exceed our financial performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use equity awards to motivate our executives to achieve superior business results over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards support our stock ownership requirements and further enhance the alignment between management and stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual equity award for our executive officers is allocated 40% in stock options, 20% in restricted stock units and 40% in performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This mix provides an incentive to achieve favorable long-term results at a reasonable cost to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentives are issued pursuant to our Omnibus Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, we awarded our named executive officers options to purchase 322,840 shares of our Common Stock, 28,705 restricted stock units of our Common Stock and 57,410 target performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards represented approximately 19% of the total equity incentives granted to management and other employees in fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that it was appropriate to award approximately 19% of the annual equity incentives to our named executive officers because they are in the best position to drive our future results and implement our long-term business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity incentives represented approximately 72% of Mr. Collis's total direct compensation and approximately 62%, on average, of the total direct compensation of the other named executive officers in fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In approving fiscal year 2016 long-term equity incentive awards, the Compensation Committee considered a number of factors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Skills, experience, time in role and expected future contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of equity awards depends in part on the scope of an executive's job responsibilities and the impact he or she can be expected to have on our future operating results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews our prior year financial performance and the executives' leadership and focus on fostering our strategic initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee sets the target value of equity awards so that our executives will have a target long-term incentive near the median of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target values are informed by the Compensation Committee's review of the competitive positioning of each element of pay based on compensation data prepared by the external compensation consultant with reference to our peer group for our CEO and CFO and with reference to published market compensation survey data for the other named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The emphasis placed on equity in the mix of total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that incentive compensation should constitute the majority of each executive's overall compensation package to provide incentives to meet our performance objectives and grow our stock price over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Average annual share use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also takes into account the average annual share use for total equity incentives granted to employees in order to provide stock options, restricted stock units and performance shares to eligible employees at a reasonable rate and cost to AmerisourceBergen and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards are subject to vesting and clawback provisions, described in more detail below and in the sections following the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When an executive retires, unvested equity awards will continue to vest according to their schedule and vested options will remain exercisable for the length of their original term (which is currently seven years).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these requirements support our goal of retaining executives and aligning individual performance with our long-term growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The post-retirement provisions provide an additional incentive for executives, particularly those near retirement, to continue to focus on our long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback provisions serve as a means to redress detrimental behavior by current and former employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Share Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our performance plan is designed to encourage our executives to focus on initiatives that promote the achievement of our long-term goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance share awards are granted annually, and each performance award is based on a performance period covering three fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance shares are subject to the attainment of performance goals approved by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting (or payout of shares) is based on cumulative performance at the end of the applicable three-year performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participating executive has the opportunity to earn a payout between 0% and 150% of his or her target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If threshold performance for a particular metric is not attained, the executive forfeits the right to receive any payout based on that metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Threshold performance for each metric will result in a share payout equal to 50% of the target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target performance for each metric will result in a share payout equal to 100% of the target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attaining the maximum goal for each metric will result in a share payout equal to 150% of the target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payout of FY14 - FY16 Performance Shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, the Compensation Committee approved the vesting and payment of the FY14 - FY16 performance shares at 150% of their target award level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee's determination was based on AmerisourceBergen's achievement of a compound annual adjusted EPS growth rate of 20.52% and an average annual adjusted ROIC of 20.73% for the three-year performance period ended September 30, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (See the footnotes to the table below for how these non-GAAP performance measures are calculated.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The FY14 - FY16 performance share awards were granted to our named executive officers (other than Mr. Mauch, who was then serving as Senior Vice President, Operations) in November 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014, the Compensation Committee approved the use of non-GAAP metrics in these awards to reflect the change in our public reporting of operating performance and earnings guidance to investors using non-GAAP financial measures, including adjusted earnings per share which occurred during the performance period covered by these awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The award metrics for the FY14 - FY16 performance share awards were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Threshold   Target   Maximum   Actual Performance                 Metric    Weighting    Baseline   Goal    Payout Ratio   Goal    Payout Ratio   Goal    Payout Ratio      Compound Annual Adjusted EPS(1)     75%     $3.21    8%     50%    11%   100%    14%   150%     20.52% Average Annual Adjusted ROIC(2)     25%         12%    50%    15%   100%    18%   150%     20.73%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Compound Annual Adjusted EPS is the mean annual growth rate of adjusted EPS from the baseline over the three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Average Annual Adjusted ROIC is calculated by taking the average of the Company's adjusted ROIC during the three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted ROIC is calculated by dividing after tax adjusted operating income by invested capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our performance, and the respective weighting of each performance metric, the number of shares earned for the FY14 - FY16 performance share awards was calculated as follows:

sentences.text: FY16 - FY18 Performance Share Metrics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approved the terms of the FY16 - FY18 performance shares in November 2015, including the following performance metrics and weightings:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Metric     Weighting Adjusted EPS       75%  Adjusted ROIC      25%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes the compound adjusted EPS and adjusted ROIC growth goals for the performance shares covering the three-year performance period (beginning on October 1, 2015 and ending September 30, 2018) can be characterized as challenging and difficult to achieve, but attainable with significant skill and effort on the part of our executive leadership team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adjusted EPS and adjusted ROIC goals of the FY16 - FY18 performance share awards are consistent with our guidance and long-range plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of the FY16 - FY18 performance share awards, performance will be assessed as of September 30, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All cash and equity awards granted under the Omnibus Incentive Plan are subject to binding, contractual obligations to comply with clawback provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executives receive their annual cash bonus and equity awards under our Omnibus Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The forfeiture or clawback of shares or other amounts received would apply if the executive is terminated for cause, breaches restrictive covenants (during the employment period or two years thereafter), or engages in any conduct (during the employment period or three years thereafter) that results in AmerisourceBergen having to restate its financial statements or engages in certain other misconduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our clawback policy also applies to any outstanding equity awards held by executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, we intend to comply with the clawback regulations ultimately finalized by the SEC and the NYSE, and intend to modify our clawback provisions in accordance with the final regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our employees who are eligible for equity awards receive those awards pursuant to the Omnibus Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, clawback provisions apply to all employees who receive equity awards from us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Award Grant Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a written policy on equity grants designed to formalize our equity grant practices and ensure that equity awards will generally be made at specified times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity award policy is not intended to and does not limit the authority of the Compensation Committee under our equity incentive plans, including the Omnibus Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee generally will review and approve annual equity awards to executives and other eligible employees in November of each year, which is near the beginning of our fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This allows the Compensation Committee to make annual equity awards at the beginning of the relevant performance cycle with the benefit of reviewing results from the immediately preceding performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also may make equity awards at other times during the year for new hires or other reasons, including, for example, a job promotion or as a result of an acquisition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our policy and our Omnibus Incentive Plan, the Compensation Committee has delegated limited authority to our CEO to approve grants to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: non-executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such awards may only be made on the first day of a month (or the next trading day, if the first day of the month is not a trading day).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee must approve any equity awards to our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price of any stock option award is the closing price of our Common Stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not backdate or retroactively grant options, restricted stock or restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally schedule Board and Compensation Committee meetings at least one year in advance and, as noted above, generally make annual equity awards to our named executive officers at approximately the same time each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not time our equity awards to take advantage of the release of earnings or other major announcements by us or market conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers receive a limited amount of other benefits as part of a competitive compensation package.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits include, as discussed below, a Company matching contribution under our 401(k) plan, which is provided to all employee participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide an allowance for tax and financial planning services for our executives to give them the opportunity to maximize the benefits from the compensation and benefits programs offered to them and to enable them to focus more of their time and attention on achieving our financial and strategic goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the aggregate, these other benefits constitute only a small percentage of each named executive officer's total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives may defer receipt of part or all of their cash compensation under our deferred compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan is intended to promote retention of executives by providing a long-term, tax efficient savings opportunity at low cost to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts deferred under the plan are deemed invested in the plan investment options chosen by the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive's account is adjusted for any notional gains and losses on the amounts deferred under the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee and Retirement Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Core employee benefits are available to the named executive officers on the same basis as all domestic employees generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits include medical and dental coverage, disability insurance, life insurance and a 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer a benefit restoration plan to selected key management, including the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We implemented this plan to address the absence of any non-legacy executive retirement plan following the 2001 merger to form the Company and to permit executives to receive the full amount of the Company match available for other employees generally under the 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan provides an annual contribution amount equal to 4% of a participant's salary and bonus to the extent that his or her compensation exceeds IRS limits applicable to our 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance and Change in Control Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide severance benefits under specified circumstances to give executives a measure of financial security following the loss of employment, to protect the Company from competitive activities after the departure of certain executives, and because we believe that these benefits are important to attract and retain our executives in a competitive industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will provide severance benefits if we discharge a named executive officer without cause or he leaves the Company for good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Good reason means a reduction in base salary or our failure to comply with our obligations (including, in some cases, by diminishing the executive's authority, duties and responsibilities) under his employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of these benefits are set out in employment agreements and various plans, which are described in the section of this proxy statement titled "Executive CompensationEmployment Agreements."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide severance benefits if a named executive officer is terminated for cause or leaves without good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that case, we would only pay the amount of accrued obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide enhanced cash compensation in connection with a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vesting of equity awards will be accelerated if a named executive officer's employment is involuntarily terminated within two years after a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a change in control, a shortened performance period, which extends only through the end of the fiscal quarter preceding the change in control, will be used to determine the payout under awards of performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide these benefits to provide financial protection to employees following an involuntary loss of employment in connection with a change in control and to enable our executives to focus on important business decisions should we be acquired without regard to how the transaction may affect them personally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this structure provides executives with an appropriate incentive to cooperate in completing a change in control transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Compensation Committee also have discretion under our equity plans to take certain actions in the event of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These actions include canceling options that are not exercised within 30 days after a change in control; cashing out outstanding options; canceling any restricted stock awards in exchange for the payment of cash, property or a combination of cash and property equal to the award's value; or substituting other property (including securities of another entity) for awards granted under our equity plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, there is discretion under the Omnibus Incentive Plan to pay cash bonuses during any year in which a change in control occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this discretion is exercised, bonus payments would be based at target level and/or based on performance for the portion of the fiscal year until the change in control event and paid within 75 days of the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any payments that are made to the named executive officer under the Omnibus Incentive Plan as a result of termination are not intended to constitute excess parachute payments within the meaning of Section 280G of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreements of the named executive officers require us to reduce these payments, if necessary, to ensure that they do not constitute excess parachute payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Stock Ownership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executives must own shares of our Common Stock in an amount equal to a multiple of their base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership aligns management's interests with those of our stockholders and provides a continuing incentive for management to focus on long-term growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our executive stock ownership guidelines, Mr. Collis must own shares worth six times his base salary and the other named executive officers must own shares worth three times their base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives who become subject to the guidelines have five years from the date of hire or change in status, whichever is later, to comply with the ownership requirements, but must retain all options and equity grants until required ownership levels are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following its annual review, the Committee determined that each of the named executive officers is in compliance with the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Derivatives Trading and Hedging Prohibition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No director, officer or employee may buy or sell options on our Common Stock or engage in short sales of our Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also prohibit directors and executive officers from pledging our stock and hedging the economic risk of ownership of our Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a written policy for our employees on these matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax and Accounting Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code generally disallows a tax deduction to public companies for annual compensation over $1 million paid to their chief executive officer and the next three most highly compensated executive officers (other than the principal financial officer).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Internal Revenue Code generally excludes from the calculation of the $1 million cap "qualified performance-based compensation."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, a portion of the compensation paid to Mr. Collis, Mr. Chou, Mr. Frary and Mr. Mauch was not deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Omnibus Incentive Plan has been structured so that compensation deemed paid to an executive officer in connection with the exercise of stock options should qualify as performance-based compensation that is not subject to the $1 million limitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, performance share awards and cash incentive awards with performance-vesting goals tied to one or more of the performance criteria approved by the stockholders may also qualify as performance-based compensation for Section 162(m) purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, restricted stock units subject only to service-vesting requirements will not qualify as such performance- based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When developing and implementing our executive compensation programs, we consider the potential deductibility of the compensation payable under those programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, it is our view that the deductibility of compensation should be only one of a number of relevant factors taken into consideration, and not the sole governing factor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that it is important to preserve flexibility in administering compensation programs in a manner designed to attract and retain executive officers who are essential to our financial success and to promote various other corporate goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we have not adopted a policy that all compensation must qualify as deductible under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may deem it appropriate to continue to provide one or more executive officers with the opportunity to earn incentive compensation that may be in excess of the amount deductible by reason of Section 162(m) or other provisions of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation and Succession Planning Committee has reviewed and discussed with management the Compensation Discussion and Analysis contained in the 2017 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review and discussion, we recommended to the Board of Directors that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in the proxy statement for our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders and incorporated by reference into our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended September 30, 2016.

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible executive officers may elect to defer up to 50% of their annual cash compensation and have the deferred amount credited in an account under the deferred compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferral elections are made in December for compensation to be earned in the next year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election forms must be filed for each year an executive officer wishes to defer compensation and each form shall specify the method of payment of benefits and the time such payment is to commence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants select the investment options under the plan and may change their election at any time by contacting the plan administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aggregate earnings and losses on plan investments are credited to participants' accounts on a quarterly basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deferred benefits will be distributed by us in accordance with the terms of the plan and payment will be made at the times elected by the executive officer in accordance with the election form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executive officer must specify whether he or she wishes to receive payment starting in the year of retirement or in the year after retirement and may elect to receive the deferred benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) over annual periods ranging from three to fifteen years and payable in quarterly installments or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) in a single distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay all costs and expenses incurred in the administration of the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AmerisourceBergen Corporation Benefit Restoration Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Selected key management, including all of the named executive officers, participate in the benefit restoration plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit restoration plan credits the account of each eligible participant with an annual amount equal to four percent (4%) of the participant's base salary and bonus incentive to the extent that his or her compensation exceeds the annual compensation limit established for our 401(k) plan by the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation limit was $265,000 for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual accruals under the executive plan commenced effective as of January 1, 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to annual accruals, certain eligible participants were credited with an initial amount based on his or her service after the merger in 2001 to form AmerisourceBergen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fidelity Investments administers the benefit restoration plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are permitted to allocate the amounts in their accounts among investment options specified by the benefit restoration plan administrator from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such allocation is only for the purposes of determining gains and losses based on the performance of the underlying investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fidelity credits participant accounts with plan benefits following the close of each calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Account balances under the benefit restoration plan do not vest in full until an employee reaches age 62 (or age 55 with more than 15 years of service), except that vesting is accelerated for disability, death and a change in control (as long as the participant is employed by the Company on the date of the change in control).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a participant is terminated for cause, he or she forfeits all vested and unvested account balances under the benefit restoration plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have employment agreements with each of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreements are substantially similar in form and substance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each employment agreement provides the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuation of base salary in effect for the named executive officer, subject to increase in accordance with our prevailing practice from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive compensation, bonus and benefits in accordance with our prevailing practice from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rights on our part to terminate the executive for cause or without cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rights on the executive's part to terminate for good reason (upon at least 60 days' prior written notice and opportunity for the Company to cure) or without good reason (upon at least 30 days' prior written notice).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During, and for a period of two years following termination of employment, each of the named executive officers has agreed not to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) compete, directly or indirectly, with any business in which we or our subsidiaries engage or are considering for development or investment or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) solicit any of our employees for employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The non-compete obligation of our named executive officers also includes the obligation to abide by non-compete obligations to which we are subject as a result of a divestiture or other contractual restrictions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential Payments upon Termination of Employment or Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination of Employment without Cause or Resignation with Good Reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers' employment agreements provide for severance payments in the event that we terminate their employment without cause or they leave the Company for good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below identifies what would constitute cause or good reason to terminate employment under the agreements:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cause for termination means: Good reason for termination means: Continued failure to substantially perform job duties     Reduction in base salary Willful misconduct    Diminution of authority, duties or responsibilities   Conviction of a felony or a misdemeanor involving moral turpitude that materially harms the Company     Failure to provide agreed position or pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to receive severance payments, the named executive officer must sign a release of any and all claims relating to his employment with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: payment of base salary for a period of two years following the loss of employment;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: payment of a pro rata bonus for the portion of the year completed prior to loss of employment or, in the case of certain executives, a two-year bonus continuation payment based on the average annual bonuses paid in the preceding three years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reimbursement of costs incurred by the executive to continue health coverage after the termination of employment;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: executive outplacement assistance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: accrued but unpaid cash compensation, such as unpaid base salary, vacation pay and business expenses (paid in a lump sum within 30 days of termination of employment)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent compliance with Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code is necessary to avoid the application of an excise tax to any of the foregoing payment and benefits, the employment agreements provide for deferral (without interest) of any affected amounts due in the six months following the termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination of Employment with Cause or Resignation without Good Reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we terminate an executive for cause or he resigns without good reason, we will not pay the executive any cash severance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will, however, pay him accrued but unpaid cash compensation through the date of termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts will include base salary through the date of termination, declared but unpaid bonus, accrued vacation pay and outstanding employee business expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Disability or Death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a named executive officer becomes disabled or dies, we will pay the executive, or his or her estate, the executive's pro rata target bonus and an amount equal to his or her accrued but unpaid cash compensation (including base salary, vacation pay and outstanding business expenses).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will pay this amount in a lump sum in cash within 30 days from the date of disability or death, except for the portion attributable to the cash bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That amount will be paid when the annual bonuses are paid to all employees generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Benefits and Deferred Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following retirement or termination of employment, our named executive officers will receive payment of retirement benefits and deferred compensation under various plans in which they participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the deferred compensation as of September 30, 2016 is set forth in the table entitled "Nonqualified Defined Contribution and Other Deferred Compensation."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no special or enhanced benefits under those plans for our named executive officers except that any account balances under the benefit restoration plan would vest upon an executive's disability or death or as a result of a change in control of the Company as long as the executive is employed by us on the date of the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide cash severance or enhanced benefits under the employment agreements with our named executive officers solely in connection with a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain of our benefit plans provide for accelerated vesting in connection with a change in control as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: account balances under the benefit restoration plan would immediately vest upon a change in control as long as the executive is still employed by us;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: unvested stock options will vest and restrictions on stock awards will lapse if the executive is involuntarily terminated by us, whether or not for cause, within two years after a change in control; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: unvested performance shares will vest in the case of an executive's involuntary termination of employment, whether or not for cause, within two years of a change in control and the payout of the award, if any, will be based on a shortened performance period (extending from the beginning of the performance period through the end of the fiscal quarter preceding the change in control).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, there are some circumstances where an award of benefits in connection with a change in control of the Company is discretionary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our internal benefits committee has discretion under our Omnibus Incentive Plan to pay bonuses to eligible employees during any year in which a change in control occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this discretion is exercised, bonus payments would be based on performance for the portion of the fiscal year until the change in control event and paid within 75 days of the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a change in control, the Board may, in its discretion, cancel outstanding options that are not exercised within 30 days of the change in control, cash out the value of outstanding options or restricted stock or make any other adjustments it deems appropriate under the Omnibus Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may also cancel any award made under the Omnibus Incentive Plan in exchange for payment of an equal value in cash or stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No payments made to a named executive officer as a result of termination may constitute excess parachute payments within the meaning of Section 280G of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreements require us to reduce, if necessary, the amount of severance due to the named executive officers in connection with a termination of employment to ensure that such payments do not constitute excess parachute payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) The value of the accelerated vesting of unvested restricted stock is calculated by multiplying the number of shares of unvested restricted stock held by the named executive officer as of September 30, 2016 by $80.78, the closing price of our Common Stock on that date.

sentences.text: The value of the accelerated vesting of unvested options is calculated by multiplying the number of unvested options held by the named executive officer on September 30, 2016 by the difference between the exercise price of the options and $80.78, the closing price of a share of our Common Stock on that date.

sentences.text: Unvested restricted stock vests in the case of disability, death or an involuntary termination of employment within two years of a change in control of the Company.

sentences.text: Account balances under the benefit restoration plan do not vest in full until an employee reaches age 62 (or age 55 with more than 15 years of service), except that vesting is accelerated upon disability, death and change in control of the Company (so long as the participant is employed by the Company on the date of the change in control).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested account balances are forfeited if the participant is terminated for any reason other than death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a participant is terminated for cause, he or she forfeits all vested and unvested account balances under the benefit restoration plan.

sentences.text: Distribution of account balances upon termination of employment, death, disability or change in control are made in a lump sum.

sentences.text: (4) In the case of death, the present value of amounts owed as salary continuation will be paid within a specified time after death.

sentences.text: CERTAIN TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is our policy with regard to loans to directors or officers?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate governance principles prohibit us from making any loans or extensions of credit to directors or executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have any programs under which we extend loans to either directors or officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is our policy with respect to transactions with related persons?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a written Related Persons Transactions Policy, which is posted under the Investors section of our Internet website at www.amerisourcebergen.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Corporate Responsibility Committee must approve or ratify any transaction, arrangement or relationship exceeding $120,000 in which the Company and any related person has a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy includes any series of transactions that exceeds $120,000 in the aggregate in any calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related persons include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: directors and nominees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: persons controlling more than 5% of our Common Stock;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the immediate family members of each of these individuals; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a firm, corporation or other entity in which any of these individuals is employed or is a partner or principal or in which any of these individuals has more than 5% ownership interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related persons must notify our General Counsel in advance of any proposed transaction with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They must explain the principal features of the proposed ransaction, including its potential value and benefit to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The General Counsel will refer all proposed related person transactions exceeding $120,000 to the Audit and Corporate Responsibility Committee for review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Corporate Responsibility Committee will consider the proposed transaction at its next regularly scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing the proposed transaction, the committee will take into account those factors it considers appropriate, including the business reasons for the transaction and whether the terms of the transaction are fair to the Company and no less favorable than would be provided by an unaffiliated third party.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee will also consider, if applicable, whether the proposed transaction would impair the independence of a director or present an improper conflict of interest for directors, nominees or executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors with an interest in any proposed transaction will not vote on the proposed transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee will review annually any ongoing related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Do we have any transactions with related persons?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Walgreens Boots Alliance, through Walgreens Boots Alliance Holdings LLC (formerly known as WAB Holdings LLC), is a person controlling more than 5% of our Common Stock, and transactions between us and Walgreens Boots Alliance are subject to our Related Persons Transactions Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a strategic relationship with Walgreens Boots Alliance established through various agreements and arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under certain of these agreements and arrangements, Walgreens Boots Alliance also has the right to designate up to two members of our Board upon achieving specified ownership levels of our Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have summarized these agreements and arrangements with Walgreens Boots Alliance below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As previously disclosed, in March 2013, we entered into various agreements and arrangements with Walgreens Boots Alliance, including a ten-year pharmaceutical distribution agreement pursuant to which we distribute branded and generic pharmaceutical products to Walgreens Boots Alliance and an agreement that provides us with the ability to access generics and related pharmaceutical products through a global sourcing arrangement with Walgreens Boots Alliance Development GmbH.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, our distribution agreement with Walgreens Boots Alliance and our global sourcing arrangement with Walgreens Boots Alliance Development GmbH were extended until 2026.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, Walgreens Boots Alliance accounted for 30% of our revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with our strategic relationship, in March 2013, we entered into a Framework Agreement with affiliates of Walgreens Boots Alliance (the "Framework Agreement") pursuant to which
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) subsidiaries of Walgreens Boots Alliance were granted the right to purchase a minority equity position in AmerisourceBergen, beginning with the right, but not the obligation, to purchase up to 19,859,795 shares of our Common Stock in open market transactions, with the right to designate up to two members of our board of directors upon achieving specified ownership levels; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) wholly-owned subsidiaries of Walgreens Boots Alliance were issued
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) warrants to purchase up to an aggregate of 22,696,912 shares of our Common Stock at an exercise price of $51.50 per share, exercisable during a six month period beginning in March 2016 (the "2016 Warrants"), and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) warrants to purchase up to 22,696,912 shares of our Common Stock at an exercise price of $52.50 per share, exercisable during a six month period beginning in March 2017 (the "2017 Warrants" and, together with the 2016 Warrants, the "Warrants").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2016, the 2016 Warrants were exercised in full for $1,168.9 million in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2016, the 2017 Warrants were amended so that they became exercisable in whole or in part during the six month period beginning in August 2016 at an exercise price of $52.50.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2016, the 2017 Warrants were exercised in full for $1,191.6 million in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As previously disclosed, we took steps to mitigate the potentially dilutive effect of the exercise of the Warrants by repurchasing shares of our Common Stock on the open market over time and through the exercise of purchased call options, by entering into a series of issuer capped call transactions with a financial institution, and by undertaking strategic acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information on the steps we took to mitigate the potentially dilutive effect of the exercise of the Warrants and the effectiveness of those steps, please see Note 9 of our 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the Framework Agreement, we entered into a Shareholders Agreement with Walgreens Boots Alliance in March 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Shareholders Agreement contains, among other things, certain restrictions on Walgreens Boots Alliance's ability to transfer its shares of our Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Shareholders Agreement also contains certain standstill provisions that, among other things and subject to certain exceptions, prohibit Walgreens Boots Alliance from acquiring additional shares of our Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The standstill provisions prohibit Walgreens Boots Alliance from entering into voting agreements or granting a proxy to any other person; participating or engaging in a proxy solicitation with respect to AmerisourceBergen; seeking to control or influence the management or policies of AmerisourceBergen; or entering into or proposing a merger, business combination or other similar extraordinary transaction involving AmerisourceBergen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The foregoing restrictions do not prohibit Walgreens Boots Alliance from, subject to certain requirements, making private proposals to AmerisourceBergen subject to the approval of our Board, or competing with third-party acquisition proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Shareholders Agreement also contains various provisions relating to board representation, voting arrangements, registration rights and other matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The subsidiaries of Walgreens Boots Alliance that participated as investors in our Common Stock (including Walgreens Boots Alliance Holdings) are also subject to the above-mentioned restrictions and provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Walgreens Boots Alliance became entitled to designate a director to our Board when it, together with its subsidiaries, achieved ownership of 5% or more of our Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Walgreens Boots Alliance met this 5% threshold as of April 9, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On November 14, 2016, Walgreens Boots Alliance filed a Schedule 13D/A with the Securities and Exchange Commission disclosing that it owned 56,854,867 shares of our Common Stock, or approximately 25.8% of our shares of Common Stock outstanding as of September 30, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ornella Barra is currently serving on our Board as Walgreens Boots Alliance's designee and is a nominee for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Barra is also a member of our Finance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Walgreens Boots Alliance will be entitled to designate a second director to our Board upon the acquisition in full by it, together with its subsidiaries, in one or more open market transactions, of 19,859,795 shares of our Common Stock (subject to certain adjustments).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of November 2, 2016, Walgreens Boots Alliance had acquired 11,461,043 shares of our Common Stock through open market transactions (all of which took place in April 2014).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Walgreens Boots Alliance divests our equity securities such that it owns less than 14%, but at least 5% of the Common Stock, Walgreens Boots Alliance will no longer be entitled to designate two directors to the Board and will only be entitled to designate one director to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Walgreens Boots Alliance divests our equity securities such that it owns less than 5% of the Common Stock, Walgreens Boots Alliance will no longer be entitled to designate any directors to the Board, and the Shareholders Agreement will, subject to certain exceptions, terminate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For so long as Walgreens Boots Alliance has the right to designate a director to our Board, subject to certain exceptions, including matters related to acquisition proposals, Walgreens Boots Alliance will be obligated to vote all of its shares of our Common Stock in accordance with the recommendation of the Board on all matters submitted to a vote of our stockholders (including the election of directors).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The wife of David W. Neu, a named executive officer in 2015, was employed as a vice president of AmerisourceBergen until July 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She received approximately $348,355 in compensation for fiscal year 2016, which consisted of salary, bonus and other cash and equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation for Ms. Neu was established in accordance with our standard employment and compensation practices applicable to employees with equivalent qualifications and responsibilities and holding similar positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE THE COMPENSATION OF OUR NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS (Item 3 on the Proxy Card)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the requirements of Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we are including this proposal, commonly known as a "say-on-pay" proposal, which gives our stockholders the opportunity to endorse our executive officer pay program and policies through the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: "RESOLVED, that the stockholders approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation paid to AmerisourceBergen's named executive officers, as disclosed in AmerisourceBergen's proxy statement for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the executive compensation tables and the related narrative discussion."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In deciding how to vote on this proposal, we encourage you to read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section beginning on page 30 for a detailed description of our executive compensation philosophy and programs, the compensation decisions of the Compensation and Succession Planning Committee under those programs and the factors considered in making those decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AmerisourceBergen's executive compensation program is strongly focused on pay for performance principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We emphasize compensation opportunities that reward our executives when they deliver targeted financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation of our named executive officers varies depending upon the achievement of pre-established performance goals, both individual and corporate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through stock ownership requirements and equity incentives, we also align the interests of our executives with those of our stockholders and the long-term interests of AmerisourceBergen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation policies have enabled AmerisourceBergen to attract and retain talented and experienced senior executives and have benefited AmerisourceBergen over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the fiscal year 2016 compensation of our named executive officers is reasonable and competitive, aligns with AmerisourceBergen's fiscal year 2016 results and positions us for future growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our stockholders to indicate their support for the compensation of our named executive officers as described in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote is advisory, it will not be binding upon the Board; however the Board values stockholders' opinions, and the Compensation and Succession Planning Committee will take into account the outcome of the vote when considering future executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board unanimously recommends that you vote For the advisory resolution approving the compensation of AmerisourceBergen's named executive officers as described in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF A STOCKHOLDER VOTE ON THE COMPENSATION OF OUR NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS (Item 4 on the Proxy Card)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What am I voting on?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n accordance with Section 14A of the Exchange Act, our Board of Directors is asking you to vote on a proposal, commonly known as a "say-when-on-pay" proposal, which gives our stockholders the opportunity to advise our Board how often we should conduct an advisory stockholder vote on the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are required to seek an advisory stockholder vote on the frequency of future say-on-pay proposals at least once every six years, although we may seek stockholder input more frequently.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are voting on the following resolution which reads:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: "RESOLVED, that a non-binding advisory vote of AmerisourceBergen's stockholders to approve the compensation of AmerisourceBergen's named executive officers, as disclosed pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission (which disclosure includes the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the Executive Compensation Tables and any related material) shall be held at an annual meeting of stockholders beginning with the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) every year,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) every 2 years, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) every 3 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The enclosed proxy card gives you four choices for voting on this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can choose whether the say-on-pay vote should be conducted every year, every 2 years or every 3 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also abstain from voting on this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are not voting to approve or disapprove the Board's recommendation on this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Is this vote binding on the Board of Directors?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote is advisory, it will not be binding upon the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, our Board values the opinions that our stockholders express in their votes and will take into account the outcome of the vote when considering how frequently we should conduct an advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers as it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How does the Board of Directors recommend that I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that an annual advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers is an important aspect of stockholder engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An annual "say-on-pay" vote facilitates direct and regular stockholder feedback on our compensation policies, which our Board values in determining the Company's compensation philosophy and designing our pay practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our stockholders' strong support in our prior "say-when-on-pay" advisory vote in 2011, our Board believes that a majority of our stockholders prefer an annual vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since the advisory vote in 2011, we have conducted "say-on-pay" votes every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, our Board recommends that you vote for conducting an advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers every year, beginning with the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
